longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To repeal and replace The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance, to repeal the Chung Chi College Incorporation Ordinance, the Board of Trustees of The United College of Hong Kong Incorporation Ordinance and the New Asia College Incorporation Ordinance and to make new provision concerning the Chung Chi College, The United College of Hong Kong and the New Asia College, to make provision for Shaw College, Morningside College, S. H. Ho College, C. W. Chu College, Wu Yee Sun College and Lee Woo Sing College, and for purposes connected therewith.

preamble.name: preamble
preamble.heading: Preamble
preamble.recital: Whereas—(a)The Chinese University of Hong Kong was established and incorporated in 1963 by The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1109, 1965 Ed.) as a University with a federal constitution;(b)the original Colleges of the University are Chung Chi College, New Asia College and The United College of Hong Kong; (Replaced 59 of 1986 s. 4)(c)it is considered desirable that some of the powers and functions conferred on the said Colleges under their respective constitutions and Ordinances should be vested in The Chinese University of Hong Kong and that the principal role of the said Colleges be the provision of student-orientated teaching under the direction of The Chinese University of Hong Kong;(d)it is also considered desirable to make certain alterations in the constitution of The Chinese University of Hong Kong;(da)the Council of the University has, by special resolutions, resolved that Shaw College, Morningside College, S. H. Ho College, C. W. Chu College, Wu Yee Sun College and Lee Woo Sing College shall be constituent Colleges of the University; (Added 59 of 1986 s. 4. Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5; 2 of 2008 s. 5)(e)it is declared that The Chinese University of Hong Kong, in which the principal language of instruction shall be Chinese, shall continue to—(i)assist in the preservation, dissemination, communication and increase in knowledge;(ii)provide regular courses of instruction in the humanities, the sciences and other branches of learning of a standard required and expected of a University of the highest standing;(iii)stimulate the intellectual and cultural development of Hong Kong and thereby to assist in promoting its economic and social welfare:

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: additional College (新增書院) means a constituent College other than an original College or Shaw College; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 3)
approved course of study (認可課程) means a course of study approved by the Senate;
Assembly of Fellows (院務委員會) means the Assembly of Fellows of a constituent College; (Amended 59 of 1986 s. 4)
Board of Trustees (書院校董會) means the Board of Trustees of an original College or Shaw College; (Amended 59 of 1986 s. 4; 18 of 2007 s. 5)

Chancellor (監督), Pro-Chancellor (副監督), Vice-Chancellor (校長), Pro-Vice-Chancellors (副校長) and Treasurer (司庫) respectively mean the Chancellor, Pro-Chancellor, Vice-Chancellor, Pro-Vice-Chancellors and the Treasurer of the University;
constituent College (成員書院) means a constituent College of the University as provided by section 3; (Replaced 59 of 1986 s. 4. Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

Council (大學校董會), Senate (教務會), Convocation (校友評議會), Faculties (學院), Schools of Studies (專業學院) and Boards of Studies (學務委員會) respectively mean the Council, Senate, Convocation, Faculties, Schools of Studies and Boards of Studies of the University; (Amended 10 of 2005 s. 21)
Fellow (院務委員) means a Fellow of a constituent College; (Amended 59 of 1986 s. 4)
graduates (畢業生) and students (學生) respectively mean the graduates and students of the University;
Head (院長) means, in relation to an original College or Shaw College, the Head of the College concerned; (Replaced 18 of 2007 s. 5)
Master of an additional College (新增書院的院長) means, in relation to an additional College, the Master of the College concerned; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 3)

def.name: OriginalCollege
def.leadIn: original College (原有書院) means any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Chung Chi College;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The United College of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: New Asia College; (Added 59 of 1986 s. 4)

subsection.def: repealed Ordinance (已廢除條例) means The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1109, 1965 Ed.) repealed by section 21;
Statutes (規程) means the Statutes of the University contained in Schedule 1 as the same may from time to time be amended or replaced under section 13(1);
University (香港中文大學) means The Chinese University of Hong Kong (香港中文大學) continued under section 4.

subsection.leadIn: A special resolution is a resolution passed at one meeting of the Council and confirmed at a subsequent meeting held not less than 1 month nor more than 6 months thereafter and which is approved at each such meeting by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not less than three-fourths of those present and voting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than half the whole membership of the Council for the time being. (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 3)

subsection.content: The constituent Colleges of the University are the original Colleges, Shaw College and such other institutions as may from time to time by Ordinance, in accordance with a special resolution of the Council, be declared to be constituent Colleges of the University. (Amended 59 of 1986 s. 4)
No provision in the constitution of any constituent College shall be of effect if it is in conflict with or inconsistent with this Ordinance. (Amended 59 of 1986 s. 4)
No person shall be excluded from being a member of the University by reason of sex, race or religion.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Continuation of incorporation of the University

subsection.content: The constituent Colleges and members of the University shall be or continue to be a body corporate called The Chinese University of Hong Kong (香港中文大學) which shall be the same University as that established by The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance 1963 (28 of 1963). (Amended 59 of 1986 s. 4)

The University shall have perpetual succession and may sue and be sued in that name and shall have and may use a common seal and may take by gift or otherwise purchase and hold, grant, demise or otherwise dispose of real or personal estate.
No dividend or bonus shall be paid and no gift or division of money shall be made by or on behalf of the University to any of its members except by way of prize, reward or special grant.

The officers of the University shall be the Chancellor, the Pro-Chancellor, the Vice-Chancellor, the Pro-Vice-Chancellors, the Treasurer, the Heads of the original Colleges and of Shaw College, the Masters of the additional Colleges, the Dean of each Faculty and of the Graduate School, the Secretary, the Registrar, the Librarian, the Bursar and such other persons as may by special resolution be designated as officers. (Amended 59 of 1986 s. 4; 18 of 2007 s. 5; 28 of 2023 s. 4)
The Chancellor shall be the head of the University and may confer degrees in the name of the University.
The Chief Executive shall be the Chancellor. (Amended 53 of 2000 s. 3)

The Chancellor may appoint a person to be the Pro-Chancellor of the University; and the Pro-Chancellor shall exercise such powers and perform such duties as may be prescribed in the Statutes and may confer degrees in the name of the University. (Amended 23 of 2002 s. 56)

The Vice-Chancellor shall be the chief academic and administrative officer of the University and shall be a member of the Council and the Chairman of the Senate, and may confer degrees in the name of the University.

The Council shall appoint, after consultation with the Vice-Chancellor, one or more Pro-Vice-Chancellors from among the regular staff of the University to exercise such powers and perform such duties as the Council may direct.
A Pro-Vice-Chancellor shall carry out all the functions and duties of the Vice-Chancellor in the absence of the Vice-Chancellor. (Amended 23 of 2002 s. 56)
The manner and period of appointment of the Treasurer shall be prescribed by the Statutes, and his duties shall be such as the Council may determine.

editorialNote.content: For the transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Statute Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance 2002 (23 of 2002), see section 65 of that Ordinance.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Provision for Council, Senate and Convocation
section.content: There shall be a Council, a Senate and a Convocation whose respective constitutions, powers and duties shall be as prescribed by this Ordinance and the Statutes.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Powers and duties of the Council
section.leadIn: Subject to this Ordinance and the Statutes, the Council shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be the governing and executive body of the University;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have the management and control of the affairs, purposes and functions of the University;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: have the control and management of the property and financial affairs of the University including the property of the constituent Colleges, but in the exercise of such power of control and management in respect of any immovable property of any original College or Shaw College, the Council shall not alter the use of any such property without the prior consent of the Board of Trustees of the College concerned; (Amended 59 of 1986 s. 4; 18 of 2007 s. 5)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: make such University appointments as it thinks proper;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: have power to approve the fees charged by the University in respect of approved courses of study;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: provide for the custody and use of the University’s seal.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Powers and duties of Senate
section.leadIn: Subject to this Ordinance and the Statutes and subject also to review by the Council, the Senate shall have the control and regulation of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: instruction, education and research;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conducting of examinations for students;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the award of degrees other than degrees honoris causa;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the award of diplomas, certificates and other academic distinctions of the University.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Composition and function of the Convocation
section.content: Subject to this Ordinance and the Statutes, the Convocation shall consist of the graduates and such other persons as may be prescribed by the Statutes and may make representations to the Council and the Senate upon any matters affecting or concerning the interests of the University.

subsection.content: The Council and the Senate may establish such committees as they think fit.
Unless otherwise provided, any committee may consist partly of persons who are not members of the Council or the Senate, as the case may be.

Subject to this Ordinance and the Statutes, the Council and the Senate may, subject to such conditions as they may impose, delegate any of their powers and duties to any Board or committee or to any officer.
Any committee established under this section may make such Standing Orders, including provision allowing a casting vote to the chairman thereof, for the conduct of meetings as it thinks fit.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Appointment of staff
section.content: Subject to this Ordinance and the Statutes, the Council shall appoint, on such terms and conditions as it thinks fit, the staff of the University.

subsection.content: The Council may establish such Faculties, Schools of Studies and other institutions as it thinks fit.
The Council, on the recommendation of the Senate, may form such institutions for the promotion of study and learning as the Council may from time to time determine.
The Senate may establish such Boards of Studies as it may from time to time determine.

subsection.leadIn: The Council may by special resolution make Statutes, subject to the approval thereof by the Chancellor, prescribing or providing for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the administration of the University;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the membership of the University;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: appointments, elections, resignation and retirement and removal of officers and teachers of the University;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: examinations;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the conferring of degrees and the award of other academic distinctions;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the composition, powers and duties of the Council and the Senate;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Faculties and Schools of Studies, their membership and functions;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the Boards of Studies, their membership and functions;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the Convocation;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the exercise of any function by the University, the Council, the Senate, the Chancellor, the Pro-Chancellor, the Vice-Chancellor, the Pro-Vice-Chancellors, other officers, teachers and other members;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: financial procedure;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: fees payable to the University as a condition of admission to any examinations held by the University or for the conferring of any of the degrees of the University or for the award of any diploma or certificate or other academic distinction or for attendance at a University Extension Course or any similar purpose;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: the admission, welfare and discipline of students; and

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: generally, the carrying into effect of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Statutes contained in Schedule 1 shall have effect as if made and approved under subsection (1).

section.name: s14
section.heading: Decrees and regulations
section.content: Subject to this Ordinance and the Statutes, the Council and the Senate may from time to time make decrees and regulations respectively to direct and regulate the affairs of the University.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Degrees and other awards
section.leadIn: The University may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confer such degrees as may be specified in the Statutes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: award diplomas and certificates and such other academic distinctions as may be specified in the Statutes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide such lectures and instruction for persons not being members of the University as the University may determine;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: confer degrees honoris causa of Master or Doctor in accordance with the Statutes; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: subject to the Statutes, deprive any person of any degree conferred or diploma, certificate or other academic distinction awarded by the University.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Honorary Degrees Committee
section.content: There shall be an Honorary Degrees Committee which shall be constituted as provided by the Statutes for the purpose of advising the Council with regard to the award of degrees honoris causa.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Execution and authentication of documents
section.content: Any instrument purporting to be executed under the seal of the University and signed by the Chancellor, Pro-Chancellor, Vice-Chancellor, a Pro-Vice-Chancellor or Treasurer and countersigned by the Secretary shall be received in evidence upon its production without further proof and shall, unless the contrary is proved, be deemed to be an instrument so executed.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Government rent
section.text: Rent payable to the Government in respect of all land granted to the University by the Government shall be limited in total to $10 a year.

subsection.content: The Chung Chi College Incorporation Ordinance (Cap. 1081, 1964 Ed.), the Board of Trustees of the United College of Hong Kong Incorporation Ordinance (Cap. 1092, 1964 Ed.) and the New Asia College Incorporation Ordinance (Cap. 1118, 1967 Ed.) are repealed.
The constitution and powers of the Boards of Trustees of the original Colleges are set out in Schedule 3. (Replaced 18 of 2007 s. 5)
The constitution and powers of the Board of Trustees of Shaw College are set out in Schedule 4. (Replaced 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Repeal of The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance and the Statutes
section.content: The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1109, 1965 Ed.) and the Statutes of The Chinese University of Hong Kong (Cap. 1109, sub. leg. 1968 Ed.) are repealed.

subsection.content: The Council and Senate appointed under the repealed Ordinance shall continue to be the Council and the Senate of the University until a new Council and Senate are constituted under the Statutes.

No other appointment made under the repealed Ordinance shall be affected by the repeal but shall, unless otherwise varied, continue on the same terms and conditions as if this Ordinance had not been enacted.

All property, whether movable or immovable, rights and privileges vested in the University immediately prior to the commencement* of this Ordinance shall continue to be vested in the University on the terms and conditions, if any, on which the same were then vested at that date, and the University shall continue to be subject to the obligations and liabilities to which it was subject immediately prior to the commencement of this Ordinance.

Nothing in this Ordinance shall affect or be deemed to affect the rights of the Central Authorities or the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region under the Basic Law and other laws or the rights of any body politic or corporate or of any other persons except such as are mentioned in this Ordinance and those claiming by, from or under them. (Added 59 of 1986 s. 4. Amended 53 of 2000 s. 3)

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Statutes of The Chinese University of Hong Kong

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: In these Statutes, unless the context otherwise requires— (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 5)
section.def: Committee of Overseers (院監會) means the Committee of Overseers of an additional College; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 5)
College (書院) means a constituent College of the University as provided by section 3; (Added 59 of 1986 s. 4. Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)
Dean (院長) means the Dean of a Faculty or of the Graduate School, as the case may be; (Added L.N. 101 of 1995)

Department (學系) means a Department of a Faculty established by the Council on the recommendation of the Senate and Departments (各學系) shall be construed accordingly and, where the context permits, a Department also refers to a School of Studies and Chairman in relation to a Department also refers to Director of a School; (Added L.N. 452 of 1994. Amended L.N. 53 of 2012)
Ordinance (條例) means The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1109); (Amended L.N. 38 of 2007)
Professor (教授) means Professors carrying the Chinese title of “教授” and those appointed before 1 January 2010 carrying the Chinese title of “講座教授”; (Added L.N. 174 of 2010)
Provost (常務副校長) means the Provost of the University appointed under paragraph 1 of Statute 7; (Added L.N. 53 of 2012. Amended 28 of 2023 s. 5)
unit (單位) means an institution established or formed by the Council under section 12 of the Ordinance. (Added L.N. 25 of 2002)

section.name: s2
section.content: The Provost is at all times one of the Pro-Vice-Chancellors. (Added 28 of 2023 s. 5)

section.name: s1
section.content: The time, place and procedure of the Congregations of the whole University shall be determined by the Chancellor.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: The Chancellor, or in his absence, one of the following persons, shall preside at Congregations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Pro-Chancellor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Council;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Pro-Vice-Chancellor who is carrying out the functions and duties of the Vice-Chancellor in the absence of the Vice-Chancellor. (Replaced 23 of 2002 s. 57)

section.name: s3
section.content: At least one Congregation shall be held in each academic year.

paragraph.leadIn: The members of the University shall be—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: the Chancellor;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: the Pro-Chancellor;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor;

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: the Pro-Vice-Chancellors;

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: the Treasurer;

subparagraph.name: f
subparagraph.content: the members of the Council;

subparagraph.name: g
subparagraph.content: the Heads of the original Colleges and of Shaw College; (Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: ga
subparagraph.content: the Masters of the additional Colleges; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 6)

subparagraph.name: h
subparagraph.content: the members of the Senate;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Emeriti, Honorary and Research Professors;

subparagraph.name: j
subparagraph.content: the teachers;

subparagraph.name: k
subparagraph.content: the Secretary, Registrar, Librarian and Bursar;

subparagraph.name: ka
subparagraph.content: the University Dean of Students; (Added L.N. 251 of 1988. Amended L.N. 114 of 1991)

subparagraph.name: l
subparagraph.content: such other persons holding such other offices or appointments at or made by the University as the Council may from time to time determine;

subparagraph.name: m
subparagraph.content: the graduates and such other persons as are entitled in accordance with Statute 18 to have their names placed upon the Convocation roll;

subparagraph.name: n
subparagraph.content: the students.

section.name: s1
section.content: The Chancellor, when present, shall preside at Congregations of the University.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: The Chancellor shall be entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to call for information in regard to any matter relating to the welfare of the University from the Vice-Chancellor and the Chairman of the Council, whose duty it shall be to provide such information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the receipt of such information to recommend to the Council such action as he deems proper.

section.name: s1
section.content: The Pro-Chancellor may, on the authorization of the Chancellor and on his behalf, exercise any of the powers or perform any of the duties conferred or imposed on the Chancellor by the Statutes.

section.name: s2
section.content: The Pro-Chancellor may resign by written notice addressed to the Chancellor.

section.name: s1
section.content: The Vice-Chancellor is to be appointed by resolution of the Council passed by the votes of not less than three-fourths of the whole membership of the Council for the time being after receiving the advice of a committee established by the Council and composed of the Chairman of the Council, 3 members nominated by the Council from among its number and 3 members nominated by the Senate from among its number.

section.name: s2
section.content: The Vice-Chancellor is to hold office for such period and on such terms as may be determined by resolution of the Council passed by the votes of not less than three-fourths of the whole membership of the Council for the time being.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: The Vice-Chancellor is to— (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have the right and duty to advise the Council on any matter affecting the policy, finance and administration of the University;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: report to the Senate at its next meeting if he has suspended or expelled any student;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: have power to appoint a person to discharge the functions and duties of the Pro-Vice-Chancellors, a Dean of a Faculty, the Chairman of a Department, the Director of a School, the Secretary, Registrar, the Librarian or the Bursar during a temporary vacancy in any such appointment or during the temporary absence or inability of the holder of any such appointment; (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994; L.N. 174 of 2010)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: have power in case of emergency to appoint external examiners.

section.name: s1
section.content: The Provost is to be appointed by resolution of the Council passed by the votes of not less than three-fourths of the whole membership of the Council for the time being, for such period and on such terms as may be determined by resolution of the Council passed by the votes of not less than three-fourths of the whole membership of the Council for the time being.

section.name: s2
section.content: The Pro-Vice-Chancellors are to be appointed by the Council for such period and on such terms as may be determined by the Council.

schedule.text: The Treasurer is to be appointed by the Chancellor and is to hold office for a period of 3 years and may be re-appointed for further periods of 3 years.

text.inline: The Heads of Original Colleges and of Shaw College

section.name: s1A
section.content: This Statute only applies to and in relation to the original Colleges and Shaw College. (Added 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Head of each College, other than the first Head, shall be appointed or re-appointed by the Council on the recommendation of a committee consisting of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor, who shall be Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one member of the Board of Trustees of the College for which the Head is to be appointed or re-appointed, elected by the Board; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 6 Fellows of that College elected under paragraph 6(b) of Statute 16 for the purpose by the Assembly of Fellows of that College.

section.name: s2
section.content: The first Head of each College shall be appointed by the Council on the recommendation of the Vice-Chancellor in consultation with the Chairman of the Board of Trustees of the College concerned for such term as the Council shall determine.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Head of a College, other than the first Head, shall be appointed for a period of 4 years and shall be eligible for re-appointment for a maximum of 2 further periods, each of 3 years.

section.name: s4
section.content: The Head of a College shall be responsible for the welfare of the College and the students assigned to it and shall collaborate closely with the Vice-Chancellor in the conduct of the College and its work.

section.name: s5
section.content: The Head of a College shall be the Chairman of the Assembly of Fellows of that College.

section.name: s6
section.content: A Head of a College shall be an academic, but need not be on the academic staff of the University at the time of his appointment.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed by the Council on the recommendation of a Board of Advisers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be the custodian of the common seal of the University;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall be with the Registrar, the joint custodian of the records of the University;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: shall be the Secretary of the Council;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: shall discharge such duties as are specified in the Ordinance and Statutes and such other duties as may be determined by the Council.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: The Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed by the Council on the recommendation of a Board of Advisers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall keep a register of all members of the University under their respective qualifications as specified in Statute 3;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall be, with the Secretary of the Council, the joint custodian of the records of the University;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: shall be the Secretary of the Senate;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: shall discharge such duties as are specified in the Ordinance and Statutes and such other duties as may be determined by the Council and Senate;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: may exercise his functions as Secretary of the Boards of the Faculties by deputy.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: The Librarian—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed by the Council on the recommendation of a Board of Advisers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be responsible for administering the library services of the University;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall discharge such duties as may be determined by the Council after consultation with the Senate.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: The Bursar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed by the Council on the recommendation of a Board of Advisers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be responsible for the keeping of all University accounts and such inventories as the Council may determine;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall discharge such other duties in connection with University finance and otherwise as may be determined by the Council;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: shall be Secretary of the Finance Committee.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: The University Dean of Students— (Amended L.N. 114 of 1991)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed by the Council on the recommendation of the Vice-Chancellor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall hold office for such period as may be determined by the Council;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall be responsible to the Vice-Chancellor for such duties in connection with student affairs as may be determined by the Council;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may be designated as an officer. (Added L.N. 251 of 1988)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Council is to consist of— (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: the Chairman, who is to be appointed by the Chancellor; (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: ab
b
subsection.content: the Vice-Chancellor;

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: the Provost; (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: ca
subsection.content: one Pro-Vice-Chancellor (other than the Provost) as determined by the Council; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: the Treasurer;

subsection.name: e
subsection.leadIn: 6 persons appointed by the Council on the nomination of the Boards of Trustees of the original Colleges and of Shaw College and the Committees of Overseers of the additional Colleges, subject to the following—

paragraph.content: the Boards of Trustees of the original Colleges and of Shaw College are to each nominate 1 person from among their own members; and
the Committees of Overseers of the additional Colleges are to jointly nominate 2 persons from among their own members; (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)
