subsection.content: 2 persons elected by, and from among, the Heads of the original Colleges and of Shaw College and the Masters of the additional Colleges, in a manner to be determined by the Council; (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: g
subsection.content: 2 persons elected by, and from among, the Deans of the Faculties and the Dean of the Graduate School, in a manner to be determined by the Council; (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: k
subsection.content: 6 persons appointed by the Chancellor; (Amended L.N. 481 of 1997; 28 of 2023 s. 10)
3 persons elected by, and from among, the Members of the Legislative Council; (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: m
subsection.content: not more than 4 persons (other than the persons referred to in subparagraph (a), (ab), (b), (c), (ca), (d), (e), (f), (g), (k) or (l)), ordinarily resident in Hong Kong, appointed by the Council, and at least one of those persons is a graduate of the University; (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: n
subsection.content: 1 member of the Convocation elected by the Convocation, in a manner to be determined by the Council; (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: o
subsection.content: 1 person elected by, and from among, full-time employees of the University who are members of the academic staff of the University, in a manner to be determined by the Council, and appointed by the Council; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: p
subsection.content: 1 person elected by, and from among, full-time employees of the University who are not members of the academic staff of the University, in a manner to be determined by the Council, and appointed by the Council; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: q
subsection.content: 1 student elected by, and from among, full-time undergraduate students pursuing approved courses of study for a degree of Bachelor of the University, in a manner to be determined by the Council, and appointed by the Council; and (Added 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.name: r
subsection.content: 1 student elected by, and from among, full-time postgraduate students pursuing approved courses of study for a degree of Master or Doctor of the University, or for any other academic award higher than a degree of Bachelor of the University, in a manner to be determined by the Council, and appointed by the Council. (Added 28 of 2023 s. 10)

Persons who hold salaried appointments in the University or who are students of the University are not eligible for appointment or election under paragraph 1(a), (ab), (e), (k), (l), (m) or (n). (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

To be eligible for election and appointment under paragraph 1(q) or (r), the student must be a full-time student pursuing an approved course of study of the University for a period of not less than 12 months. (Added 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s3
section.content: The Chairman of the Council is to hold office for 3 years and may be re-appointed for further periods of 3 years. (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s3A
section.content: The Chairman of the Council may confer degrees in the name of the University. (Added 23 of 2002 s. 61)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subparagraph (4), members of the Council appointed or elected under paragraph 1(k), (l), (m) or (n)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold office for a period of 3 years from the date of their appointment or election, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are eligible for re-appointment or re-election, as the case may be, for further periods of 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subparagraph (5), a member of the Council elected and appointed under paragraph 1(o) or (p)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds office for a period of 3 years from the date of his or her appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is eligible for re-election and re-appointment for further periods of 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subparagraphs (4) and (5), members of the Council appointed or elected under paragraph 1(e), (f) or (g)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold office for a period of 1 year from the date of their appointment or election, as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are eligible for re-appointment or re-election, as the case may be, for further periods of 1 year.

subsection.content: A member of the Council appointed or elected under paragraph 1(e), (l) or (n) ceases to be a member of the Council if the member ceases to be a member of the body from among whose members the member was appointed or elected, as the case may be.

A member of the Council elected under paragraph 1(f) or (g), or elected and appointed under paragraph 1(o) or (p), ceases to be a member of the Council if the member ceases to meet the criteria of eligibility for election.

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Council elected under paragraph 1(l) or (n) dies or resigns during the member’s period of membership, or ceases to be a member of the Council under subparagraph (4), the body that elected the member, or from among whose members the member was elected, as the case may be, must duly elect a successor under the same paragraph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose membership of the Council must be for a period not exceeding 3 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is eligible for re-election under subparagraph (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Council elected and appointed under paragraph 1(o) or (p) dies or resigns during the member’s period of membership, or ceases to be a member of the Council under subparagraph (5), the full-time employees of the University from among whom the member was elected must duly elect a successor under the same paragraph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose membership of the Council must be for a period not exceeding 3 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is eligible for re-election and re-appointment under subparagraph (2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Council appointed under paragraph 1(e) dies or resigns during the member’s period of membership, or ceases to be a member of the Council under subparagraph (4), the Council must duly appoint a successor under paragraph 1(e)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose membership of the Council must be for a period not exceeding 1 year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is eligible for re-appointment under subparagraph (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Council elected under paragraph 1(f) or (g) dies or resigns during the member’s period of membership, or ceases to be a member of the Council under subparagraph (5), the Heads and the Masters, or the Deans, as the case may be, from among whom the member was elected must duly elect a successor under the same paragraph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose membership of the Council must be for a period not exceeding 1 year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is eligible for re-election under subparagraph (3)(b). (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: If a member of the Council appointed under paragraph 1(k) or (m) dies or resigns during the member’s period of membership, the Chancellor or the Council, as the case may be, must duly appoint a successor under the same paragraph—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: whose membership of the Council must be for a period not exceeding 3 years; and

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: who is eligible for re-appointment under paragraph 4(1)(b). (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s6
section.content: Members of the Council whose membership derives from paragraph 1(b), (c), (ca) and (d) are to remain members of the Council for so long as they hold the office by reason of which they became members of the Council. (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subparagraph (3), a student member of the Council elected and appointed under paragraph 1(q) or (r)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds office for a period of 1 year from the date of his or her appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is eligible for re-election and re-appointment, but no student may be a member of the Council for more than 2 consecutive terms of office.

subsection.leadIn: If a student member of the Council elected and appointed under paragraph 1(q) or (r) dies or resigns during the student member’s period of membership, or ceases to be a member of the Council under subparagraph (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if the student member’s unexpired period of membership is 6 months or longer) a successor is to be elected in a manner to be determined by the Council and appointed by the Council for that unexpired period of membership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the student member’s unexpired period of membership is shorter than 6 months) no successor is to be elected and appointed for that unexpired period of membership.

subsection.content: A student member of the Council elected and appointed under paragraph 1(q) or (r) ceases to be a member of the Council if the student member ceases to meet the criteria of eligibility for election and appointment. (Added 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s7
section.content: The Vice-Chairman of the Council is to hold office for a period of 3 years and may be re-appointed for further periods of 3 years. (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: Subject to the Ordinance and the Statutes and without derogating from the generality of its power, it is specifically prescribed—

subsection.leadIn: that the Council is to have the power— (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make Statutes, provided that no Statute is to be made until the Senate is to have had an opportunity of reporting thereon to the Council; (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make decrees for any purpose for which decrees are or may be authorized to be made, provided that no decree is to be made until the Senate is to have had an opportunity of reporting thereon to the Council; (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to invest any money belonging to the University;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to borrow money on behalf of the University;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to sell, buy, exchange, lease or accept leases of any real or personal property on behalf of the University;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to enter into, vary, perform and cancel contracts on behalf of the University;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in relation to the original Colleges and Shaw College, to require the Board of Trustees of each College annually to produce its audited accounts in such form and at such time as the Council may determine; (Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to receive from public sources grants for capital and recurrent expenditure;

paragraph.name: i
j
paragraph.content: to receive gifts and to approve, subject to such conditions as the Council thinks fit, the receipt of gifts by the Colleges;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: to provide for the welfare of persons employed by the University and the wives, widows and dependants of such persons, including the payment of money, pensions, or other payments and to subscribe to benevolent and other funds for the benefit of such persons;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: to provide for the discipline and welfare of students;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: to recommend the award of degrees honoris causa;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: after report from the Senate to establish additional Faculties, Departments or Schools of Studies or to abolish, combine or subdivide any Faculty, Department or School of Studies; (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994; L.N. 174 of 2010)

paragraph.name: na
paragraph.content: on the recommendation of the Senate, to determine the organization or structure of each Faculty and its Departments and each School of Studies and to make such alterations to such organization or structure as deemed fit by the Council; (Added L.N. 452 of 1994. Amended L.N. 174 of 2010)

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: to prescribe fees of the University;

subsection.leadIn: that it is to be the duty of the Council— (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to appoint bankers, auditors and any other agents whom it deems expedient to appoint;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to appoint an Administrative and Planning Committee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to cause proper books of account to be kept for all sums of money received and expended by the University and for the assets and liabilities of the University so that such books give a true and fair statement of financial transactions and position of the University;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: to provide the buildings, libraries, laboratories, premises, furniture, apparatus and other equipment needed for the University;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in consultation with the Senate to encourage and provide for research by members of the University;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: after consultation with the Senate, to institute all teaching posts;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to administer or cause to be administered a Superannuation Fund or Funds for the benefit of persons employed by the University;

paragraph.name: ia
paragraph.content: to make, on such terms and conditions and in accordance with such procedures as the Council may determine from time to time, such University appointments as the Council deems necessary, and for the appointment of teachers, after consulting the Senate or member or members of the Senate designated by the Senate for the purpose of appointment of teachers; (Added L.N. 174 of 2010)

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: on the recommendation of the Senate, to appoint a Chairman for each Department, a Director for each School and a Director of Studies for each academic subject not subsumed under a Department or a School of Studies; (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994; L.N. 174 of 2010)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: to appoint external examiners on the recommendation of the Senate;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: to provide for the printing and publication of works which may be issued by the University; and

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: to consider reports from the Senate, and if the Council deems it proper to do so, to take action thereon.

section.name: s9
section.content: The Council must meet at least 3 times in each academic year and additionally on the written request of the Chairman of the Council or the Vice-Chancellor or any 5 members of the Council. (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s9A
section.content: The Council may transact any of its business by circulation of papers, and unless the Vice-Chancellor or 5 members of the Council in writing request the Chairman of the Council to refer any particular item of the business being so transacted to the next meeting of the Council, a resolution in writing which is approved in writing by a majority of the members of the Council for the time being is to be as valid and effectual as if it had been passed at a meeting of the Council. (Added L.N. 256 of 1998. Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The Council may determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether student members of the Council or of any committees or other bodies as the Council may establish are allowed to participate in that part of meetings considering any reserved areas of business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if they are so allowed) the manner of their participation.

subsection.content: Those student members who are allowed to participate in that part of meetings considering any reserved areas of business may, subject to any conditions as the Council may determine, access and read the papers relating to those areas.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Statute, the reserved areas of business are the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: matters affecting the appointment, promotion and other affairs relating to teachers and members of the University staff as individuals;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: matters affecting the admission and academic assessment of students as individuals;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: expenditure estimates and other matters concerning the finances of the University.

subsection.content: The Chairman of the Council, or the Chairman of the committee or other body established by the Council, as the case may be, may decide in any case of doubt whether or not a matter falls within one of the reserved areas of business referred to in subparagraph (3) and the Chairman’s decision is final. (Added 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s10
section.content: 7 days’ notice in writing of any meeting of the Council must be sent by the Secretary to each person entitled to receive notice of the meeting with the agenda thereof, and no business not included in the agenda is to be transacted if the Chairman or any 2 members present object. (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s11
section.content: The Council may make for the proper conduct of its business Standing Orders which it may amend or rescind by simple majority at any of its meetings provided that not less than 7 days’ notice has been given in writing by the Secretary to members of the Council of the proposal so to amend or rescind.

section.name: s12
section.content: The quorum at any meeting of the Council is not less than one-half of the whole membership of the Council for the time being. (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 10)

section.name: s1
section.content: There shall be a constitution for each additional College. The constitution shall be subject to the approval of the Council.

section.name: s2
section.content: The name, structure and organization of each additional College shall be determined by the Council.

section.name: s1
section.content: The Council shall fix the financial year.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: There shall be a Committee of the Council known as the Finance Committee, which shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Treasurer, who shall be Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor or his representative;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Heads of the original Colleges and of Shaw College; and (Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 3 other persons, including persons who are not members of the Council, as the Council shall appoint.

section.continued: There shall be referred to the Finance Committee all matters within the jurisdiction of the Council which have important financial implications.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Finance Committee shall submit to the Council, before the beginning of the financial year, draft estimates of income and expenditure of the University and such estimates, amended as the Council may think fit, shall be approved by the Council before the beginning of the financial year.

section.name: s4
section.content: The estimates shall show the income and expenditure of the University and the estimated surplus or deficit for the year. The estimated expenditure shall be shown under votes, heads and (where applicable) sub-heads. Any transfer between votes or heads shall require the sanction of the Finance Committee. Any transfer between sub-heads shall require the sanction of the Vice-Chancellor and the Treasurer, with the exception of transfers between sub-heads solely concerning an original College or Shaw College, which shall require the sanction of the Head of the College concerned, subject to any rules and directions that the Finance Committee may issue. (Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s5
section.content: The Finance Committee shall report to the Council, at such times as the Council may determine, any transfer between votes or heads. The Council may revise the estimates during the course of the financial year.

section.name: s6
section.content: As soon as practicable after the end of the financial year, a balance sheet and income and expenditure account with supporting schedules shall be submitted to the auditors.

section.name: s7
section.content: The audited accounts, with any comments thereon made by the auditors, shall be submitted to the Council.

section.name: s8
section.content: Nothing in this Statute shall deprive the Council of power to invest surpluses or prospective surpluses at any time.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: There shall be a Committee of the Council known as the Administrative and Planning Committee, which shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor, who shall be the Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Pro-Vice-Chancellors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Heads of the original Colleges and of Shaw College; (Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: the Masters of the additional Colleges; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Dean of each Faculty and of the Graduate School;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Secretary;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Registrar;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Bursar; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the University Dean of Students. (Added L.N. 103 of 1999)

section.continued: The Secretary or his deputy shall serve as secretary of the Committee. (Amended L.N. 103 of 1999)

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: Subject to the Ordinance and the Statutes, it shall be the duty of the Administrative and Planning Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to assist the Vice-Chancellor in the performance of his duties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to initiate plans of University development;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.content: to deal with other matters referred to it by the Council.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Administrative and Planning Committee shall report to the Council through the Vice-Chancellor.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Senate shall consist of—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: the Vice-Chancellor who shall be Chairman;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: the Pro-Vice-Chancellors;

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: the Heads of the original Colleges and of Shaw College; (Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

subsection.name: ca
subsection.content: the Masters of the additional Colleges; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 12)

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: the Dean of each Faculty and of the Graduate School;

subsection.name: e
subsection.content: the Professors who carry the Chinese title of “講座教授”, or the Readers and any other professors who are determined by the Council to be of a grade equivalent to or higher than Readers in each Department and each School of Studies in which there is no professor who carries the Chinese title of “講座教授”; (Replaced L.N. 174 of 2010. Amended L.N. 53 of 2012)

subsection.name: f
subsection.content: the Chairman of each Department and the Directors of Studies if not a member under subparagraph (e); (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994)

subsection.name: fa
subsection.content: the Director of the School of Continuing and Professional Studies of the University; (Added L.N. 257 of 2000. Amended L.N. 38 of 2007)

subsection.name: g
subsection.content: in relation to the original Colleges and Shaw College, 2 Fellows of each College elected by the College’s Assembly of Fellows; (Replaced L.N. 25 of 1987. Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

subsection.name: h
subsection.content: the Registrar;

subsection.name: i
subsection.content: the Librarian; (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994)

subsection.name: j
subsection.content: the University Dean of Students; (Added L.N. 251 of 1988. Amended L.N. 114 of 1991)

subsection.name: k
subsection.content: the President of the University Students Union; (Added L.N. 251 of 1988)

subsection.name: l
subsection.content: 1 student of each Faculty of the University elected by, and from among, full-time students in that Faculty pursuing approved courses of study for a degree of the University; (Replaced L.N. 175 of 1996. Amended L.N. 357 of 2000)

subsection.name: m
subsection.content: in relation to the original Colleges and Shaw College, 1 student representing the Students Union of each College of the University elected by, and from among, full-time students pursuing approved courses of study for a degree of the University who are members of that Students Union. (Added L.N. 357 of 2000. Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s2
section.content: Members of the Senate (other than Fellows elected under paragraph 1(g) and student members elected under paragraph 1(l) or (m)) shall remain members of the Senate for so long as they hold the office or appointment by reason of which they became members of the Senate. (Amended L.N. 251 of 1988; L.N. 357 of 2000; 18 of 2007 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Fellows elected under paragraph 1(g) shall hold office for 2 years from the date of their election and shall be eligible for re-election provided that they shall cease to be members of the Senate if they cease to be assigned to the College by whose Assembly of Fellows they were elected. Should an elected member die or resign from the Senate or cease to be a Fellow within the College by whose members he was elected a successor shall be duly elected who shall be a member of the Senate for the unexpired period of membership of his predecessor.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Student members under paragraph 1(l) or (m) shall be elected in such manner as may be determined by the Senate. (Added L.N. 251 of 1988. Amended L.N. 357 of 2000)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Student members elected under paragraph 1(l) or (m) shall hold office for a period of one year and shall be eligible for re-election provided that no student shall be a member of the Senate for more than 2 consecutive terms of office. If a student member resigns or ceases to be a member of the Senate and his unexpired period of membership is 6 months or longer, then a successor shall be elected in accordance with subparagraph (b) for that unexpired period of membership, but if his unexpired period of membership is shorter than 6 months, then no successor shall be elected for that unexpired period of membership. (Added L.N. 251 of 1988. Amended L.N. 357 of 2000)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: A student member shall cease to be a member of the Senate if he ceases to be a registered student of the University or if he is suspended from pursuing full-time study at the University. (Added L.N. 251 of 1988)

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: Subject to the Ordinance and Statutes, the Senate shall have the following powers and duties—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: to promote research by members of the University;

subsection.name: b
c
d
subsection.content: to consider, upon the advice of the Assembly of Fellows of each College, measures necessary for the conduct of student-orientated teaching, and to consider also measures necessary for the conduct of subject-orientated teaching;

subsection.name: e
f
subsection.content: to appoint internal examiners after report from the Boards of the Departments and the Boards of the Schools of Studies concerned; (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994; L.N. 174 of 2010)

subsection.name: g
subsection.content: to recommend after report from the Boards of the Departments and the Boards of the Schools of Studies concerned external examiners for appointment by the Council; (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994; L.N. 174 of 2010)

subsection.name: h
subsection.content: to recommend the conferment of degrees (other than degrees honoris causa) and to award diplomas, certificates and other distinctions;

subsection.name: i
ja
subsection.leadIn: to assign teachers—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to Faculties, Departments and Schools of Studies; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to units, if the Senate thinks it fit in relation to such units; (Added L.N. 25 of 2002)

subsection.name: l
subsection.content: to report to the Council on all Statutes and Decrees and proposed changes thereof;

subsection.name: m
subsection.content: to report to the Council on any academic matter;

subsection.name: n
subsection.content: to discuss any matter relating to the University and to report its views to the Council;

subsection.name: o
subsection.content: to report to the Council on any matters referred to the Senate by the Council;

subsection.name: p
subsection.content: to consider estimates of expenditure prepared in respect of the University, and to report thereon to the Council;

subsection.name: q
subsection.content: to formulate, modify or revise schemes for the organization of Faculties and to assign to such Faculties their respective subjects; also to report to the Council on the expediency of establishing at any time other Faculties or as to the expediency of abolishing, combining or sub-dividing any Faculties;

subsection.name: s
subsection.content: to supervise the libraries and laboratories;

subsection.name: t
subsection.content: to require any undergraduate or student on academic grounds to terminate his studies at the University;

subsection.name: u
subsection.leadIn: to determine—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the academic terms which shall be part of an academic year;

subsection.name: v
subsection.content: to exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as the Council may authorize or require.

section.name: s5
section.content: The Senate shall hold at least 3 meetings in each academic year and additionally at any time at the direction of the Chairman or on the written request of any 10 members of the Senate. (Amended L.N. 251 of 1988)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether student members of the Senate and of such committees and other bodies as the Senate may establish are allowed to participate in that part of meetings considering reserved areas of business; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (if they are so allowed) the manner of their participation. (Replaced L.N. 5 of 2006)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: Those student members who are allowed to participate in that part of meetings considering reserved areas of business may, subject to such conditions as the Senate may determine, access and read the papers relating to those areas. (Added L.N. 5 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: The reserved areas of business are the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: matters affecting the appointment, promotion and other affairs relating to teachers and members of the University staff as individuals;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: matters affecting the admission and academic assessment of students as individuals;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: expenditure estimates and other matters concerning the finances of the University.

paragraph.continued: The Chairman of the Senate, or the Chairman of the committee or other body established by the Senate, as the case may be, may decide in any case of doubt whether or not a matter falls within one of the reserved areas of business referred to above and his decision shall be final. (Added L.N. 251 of 1988)

section.name: s6
section.content: 7 days’ notice in writing of any meeting of the Senate shall be sent by the Registrar to each person entitled to receive notice of the meeting with the agenda therefor and no business not on such agenda shall be transacted if the Chairman or any 4 members present object. (Amended L.N. 251 of 1988)

section.name: s7
section.content: The Senate may make for the proper conduct of its business Standing Orders which it may amend or rescind by simple majority at any of its meetings provided that not less than 7 days’ notice has been given in writing by the Registrar to members of the Senate of the proposal so to amend or rescind.

section.name: s8
section.content: The quorum at any meeting of the Senate be 24. (Amended L.N. 251 of 1988)

text.inline: The Faculties and the Graduate School

section.name: s1
section.content: The Vice-Chancellor shall be a member of each Faculty. (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994)

section.name: s2
section.content: Each teacher assigned by the Senate to a Faculty or Faculties shall be a member of such Faculty or Faculties during the tenure of his appointment. (Amended L.N. 25 of 2002)

subsection.leadIn: Unless otherwise provided in subparagraph (2), the Dean of each Faculty shall be appointed by the Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the recommendation of the Vice-Chancellor after he has received the advice of the search committee concerned composed of such members as may be elected or nominated in accordance with regulations approved by the Council from time to time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a period of 5 years or such shorter period as may be determined by the Council;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Council; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to sub-subparagraphs (a), (b) and (c), in accordance with regulations approved by the Council from time to time.

subsection.content: The first Dean of a newly-established Faculty shall be appointed by the Council on the recommendation of the Vice-Chancellor for a period of 5 years or such shorter period and on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Council.

On the recommendation of the Vice-Chancellor, the Dean of each Faculty shall be eligible for re-appointment by the Council, and each period of re-appointment shall be for a period of 5 years or such shorter period as may be determined by the Council, provided that a Dean’s total period of appointment (not including any period he has previously served as a Dean elected under paragraphs 3 and 4 as repealed by the Statutes of The Chinese University of Hong Kong (Amendment) (No. 2) Statute 2007 (L.N. 109 of 2007) (the Amendment Statute)) shall not exceed 10 years. (Replaced L.N. 109 of 2007)

section.name: s4
section.content: The Dean of any Faculty elected under paragraph 3 or 4 as repealed by the Amendment Statute and holding office as such Dean immediately before the commencement* of the Amendment Statute shall continue to hold that office until the expiry of his current term of office or until such time when he vacates the office before such expiry. (Replaced L.N. 109 of 2007)

section.name: s5
section.content: Each Faculty shall meet at least once a year, and shall have the power to discuss any matters relating to the Faculty and to express its opinion thereon to the Senate.

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: A Board of Faculty shall be established for each Faculty and shall consist of—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: the Vice-Chancellor;

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: the Dean of the Faculty, who shall be Chairman; (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 13)

subsection.name: da
e
subsection.content: the Chairman of each Department, the Director of each School and the Directors of Studies within the Faculty; (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994; L.N. 174 of 2010)

subsection.name: ea
subsection.content: such number of teachers as determined by the Senate, representing varying teacher grades within the Faculty nominated in accordance with regulations approved by the Senate from time to time; (Added L.N. 174 of 2010. Amended L.N. 53 of 2012)

subsection.name: g
subsection.content: in relation to the original Colleges and Shaw College, one representative of each Assembly of Fellows who shall be a member of the Faculty; (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994; 18 of 2007 s. 5)

subsection.name: j
subsection.content: 1 student elected by, and from among, full-time students of the Faculty pursuing approved courses of study for a degree of the University. (Added L.N. 174 of 2010)
A student member elected under paragraph 6(j) is to be elected in such manner and for such period as the Senate may in its absolute discretion determine. (Replaced L.N. 174 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: The Senate may determine—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: (if they are so allowed) the manner of their participation.

subsection.content: Those student members who are allowed to participate in that part of meetings considering reserved areas of business may, subject to such conditions as the Senate may determine, access and read the papers relating to those areas.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Statute, reserved areas of business are the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: matters affecting the appointment, promotion and other affairs relating to teachers and members of the University staff as individuals;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: matters affecting the admission and academic assessment of students as individuals;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: expenditure estimates and other matters concerning the finances of the University.

subsection.continued: The Chairman of the Board of the Faculty may decide in any case of doubt whether or not a matter falls within a reserved area of business and his decision shall be final.

subsection.leadIn: The Senate may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delegate its power under subparagraphs (2) and (3) to the Board of a Faculty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose conditions subject to which the delegated power may be exercised.

subsection.content: The Board of a Faculty may make Standing Orders for the proper conduct of its business. (Added L.N. 38 of 2007)

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: The Board of Faculty shall co-ordinate the activities of the Departments and Schools of Studies within the Faculty and it shall be its function to consider and deal with the recommendations of the Departments and Schools of Studies— (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994; L.N. 174 of 2010)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the content of courses for the degree or degrees; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the details of syllabuses.

section.name: s8
section.content: The Dean of the Graduate School shall be appointed by the Council on the recommendation of the Vice-Chancellor for a period to be determined by the Council.

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: The Council of the Graduate School shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Dean of the Graduate School, who shall be Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Deans of the Faculties;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Heads of the Divisions in the Graduate School;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Librarian;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Master of the Postgraduate Hall Complex.

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: Subject to the Ordinance and the Statutes, the Council of the Graduate School shall have the following powers and duties—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to advise the Senate on all graduate programmes of studies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to co-ordinate the activities of the Divisions within the Graduate School;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to consider and deal with the recommendations of the various Divisions on the content of courses and on the details of syllabuses.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Council shall initially appoint 6 Fellows for each College on the recommendation of a Committee consisting of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor, who shall be Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 3 Professors nominated by Professors who are on the existing staff of that College; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 3 Associate Professors or Assistant Professors nominated by staff in those grades, who are on the existing staff of that College.

section.continued: At least 3 of the 6 Fellows so appointed shall be drawn from the existing staff of that College. (Amended L.N. 174 of 2010)

section.name: s2A
section.content: In relation to the original Colleges and Shaw College, the Fellows of each College appointed under paragraph 1 shall, together with the Head of that College, form an Assembly of Fellows of that College. (Added 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s2B
section.content: In relation to the additional Colleges, the Fellows of each College appointed under paragraph 1 shall form an Assembly of Fellows of that College. (Added 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s3
section.content: In relation to the original Colleges and Shaw College, the Head of a College shall be the Chairman of the Assembly of Fellows of that College. (Replaced 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s4
section.content: Subject to paragraph 6, the Assembly of Fellows of each College may elect additional Fellows to that Assembly from the academic staff of the University who have been assigned to the College concerned.

section.name: s5
section.content: A Fellow shall hold office for 5 years and shall be eligible to hold office again as a Fellow.

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: In relation to the original Colleges and Shaw College, the Assembly of Fellows of each College shall—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when necessary, elect 6 Fellows of varying academic seniority for the purposes of serving on the Committee constituted under paragraph 1 of Statute 9. (Replaced 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s6A
section.leadIn: The Assembly of Fellows of each College shall be responsible for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: arranging the tutorial instruction, pastoral counselling and student-orientated teaching of the students assigned to the College;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the supervision of residential accommodation for certain students at the College; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the maintenance of discipline within the College. (Added 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s7
section.content: An Assembly of Fellows may make Standing Orders for the proper conduct of its business.

section.name: s1
section.content: Each Department shall consist of the Vice-Chancellor and all the teachers assigned to the Department.

section.name: s2
section.content: The Chairman of each Department shall be appointed by the Council on the recommendation of the Senate for such period as may be determined by the Council.

subsection.leadIn: A Board shall be established for each Department and shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: the Dean of any Faculty to which the Department is affiliated; (Added L.N. 101 of 1995)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Department, who shall be Chairman of the Board; (Amended L.N. 53 of 2012)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all Professors, Associate Professors and Assistant Professors, and such other teachers who are determined by the Council to be of or equivalent to these grades who are assigned to the Department or School of Studies; and (Replaced L.N. 53 of 2012)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such number of teachers as determined by the Senate, representing such teacher grades other than those specified in sub-subparagraph (c) who are assigned to the Department or School of Studies nominated in accordance with regulations approved by the Senate from time to time. (Added L.N. 53 of 2012)

subsection.content: A teacher, who contributes substantially to the teaching of students pursuing courses of study within the purview of a Department but who is not assigned to that Department, becomes a member of the Board of that Department on being nominated by that Board and approved by the Senate. (Replaced L.N. 25 of 2002)

At the discretion of the Board of the Department, the Board may nominate such students as the Board deems fit as student members for such period as the Board may in its absolute discretion determine. (Amended L.N. 478 of 1996; L.N. 5 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: The Senate may determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether student members of the Board are allowed to participate in that part of meetings considering reserved areas of business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if they are so allowed) the manner of their participation. (Added L.N. 5 of 2006)

subsection.content: Those student members who are allowed to participate in that part of meetings considering reserved areas of business may, subject to such conditions as the Senate may determine, access and read the papers relating to those areas. (Added L.N. 5 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Statute, reserved areas of business are the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: matters affecting the appointment, promotion and other affairs relating to teachers and members of the University staff as individuals;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: matters affecting the admission and academic assessment of students as individuals;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: expenditure estimates and other matters concerning the finances of the University.

subsection.continued: The Chairman of the Board may decide in any case of doubt whether or not a matter falls within a reserved area of business and his decision shall be final. (Added L.N. 5 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: The Senate may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delegate its power under subparagraphs (4) and (5) to the Board of a Department; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose conditions subject to which the delegated power may be exercised. (Added L.N. 5 of 2006)

section.name: s3A
section.content: The Board of a Department may make Standing Orders for the proper conduct of its business. (Added L.N. 5 of 2006)

section.name: s4
section.content: It is the duty of the Board of a Department to advise the Senate on the courses of study within the purview of the Department, on the appointment of internal and external examiners and on other matters that the Senate may request.

section.name: s5
section.content: A Department shall perform such other functions and duties as may be determined from time to time by the Council on the recommendation of the Senate.

section.name: s1
section.content: There shall be a Convocation of the University which shall consist of all persons whose names appear on the Convocation roll.

content.leadIn: All persons who are graduates of the University shall be entitled to have their names entered on the Convocation roll:
content.proviso: Provided that persons on whom a degree honoris causa has been conferred shall not solely by reason thereof be members of Convocation, but may be elected by Convocation to be members thereof.

section.name: s3
section.content: Any person who obtains a diploma issued by the Post-Secondary Colleges Joint Diploma Board in the academic year of establishment of the University shall be entitled to have his name entered on the Convocation roll.

section.name: s3A
section.content: Any person who had been admitted as a registered student of an original College before the date of establishment of the University, pursued a course of study of not less than 4 years’ duration in that original College, and obtained a diploma issued by that original College or by the Post-Secondary Colleges Joint Diploma Board on satisfactory fulfilment of all the requirements prescribed therefor may register with the Registrar of the University to have his name entered on the Convocation roll. (Added L.N. 167 of 1993)

section.name: s3B
section.content: Any person who has attended an approved course of study for not less than 1 academic year after admission as a registered postgraduate student to a Faculty or a School of Studies and has been awarded a postgraduate diploma by the Senate on satisfactory fulfilment of all the requirements prescribed therefor may register with the Registrar of the University to have his name entered on the Convocation roll. (Added L.N. 167 of 1993. Amended L.N. 174 of 2010)

section.name: s4
section.content: The Convocation shall from its own members elect a Chairman and may elect a Vice-Chairman who shall respectively hold office for such periods as the Convocation may determine. No member shall be eligible for election as Chairman or Vice-Chairman unless he is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong. Any retiring Chairman or Vice-Chairman shall be eligible for re-election. (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 15)

section.name: s5
section.content: In case of any casual vacancy in the office of Chairman or Vice-Chairman, the Convocation shall elect one of its members to fill the vacancy and the person so elected shall hold office for the remainder of the term for which his predecessor was appointed.

subsection.content: Subject to subparagraph (2), the Convocation is to elect 1 member of the Convocation, in a manner to be determined by the Council, to be a member of the Council. (Replaced 28 of 2023 s. 15)

No member of the Convocation shall be eligible for election under subparagraph (1) to serve, or continue to serve, as a member of the Council if he is or becomes a member of the University by virtue of Statute 3, unless he is such a member by virtue of paragraph (m) only, and not at the same time such a member by virtue of any other paragraph, of that Statute, but, save as aforesaid, a member of the Convocation elected under subparagraph (1) shall continue to be a member of the Council, and shall be eligible for re-election, notwithstanding his being a member of the University by virtue of paragraphs (f) and (m) of Statute 3 at the same time so long as he is such a member of the Council by virtue of paragraph 1(n) of Statute 11 only, and not at the same time a member of the Council by virtue of any other paragraph of that Statute. (Amended L.N. 327 of 1996; L.N. 481 of 1997)

section.name: s8
section.content: The Convocation shall, after a date to be determined by the Council, meet at least once in each calendar year and notice of such meeting shall be given 4 weeks before the date of meeting. Any member desiring to bring forward any business thereat shall forward a statement in writing to reach the Secretary of the Convocation at least 2 weeks before the date of meeting, setting forth in the form of motions the subject or subjects proposed for consideration. (Amended L.N. 548 of 1994)

section.name: s9
section.content: The quorum at any meeting of the Convocation shall be as prescribed by the Council after report from the Convocation.

section.name: s10
section.content: The constitution, functions, privileges and other matters relating to the Convocation shall be subject to the approval of the Council.

paragraph.leadIn: The academic staff of the University shall consist of—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor;

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: the Pro-Vice-Chancellors;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: the Heads of the original Colleges and of Shaw College; (Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: ca
subparagraph.content: the Masters of the additional Colleges; (Added 28 of 2023 s. 16)

subparagraph.name: d
subparagraph.content: the teachers;

subparagraph.name: e
subparagraph.content: the Librarian; and

subparagraph.name: f
subparagraph.content: such other persons as the Council on the recommendation of the Senate may prescribe.

section.name: s1
section.content: The Council may appoint Honorary Professors and may award the title of Emeritus Professor to any Professor who has retired from office provided that such appointment or award is recommended by the Senate.

section.name: s2
section.content: An Honorary or Emeritus Professor shall not ex officio be a member of the Senate or of any Faculty, Department or School of Studies. (Amended L.N. 452 of 1994; L.N. 174 of 2010)

schedule.text: Any person wishing to resign from any office or membership of any body shall do so by notice in writing.

section.name: s1
section.content: The Council may for good cause as defined in paragraph 2 remove any member of the Council other than the Chairman, the Vice-Chairman, the Treasurer and any person appointed under paragraph 1(k) and (1) of Statute 11 from his membership of the Council. (Amended 28 of 2023 s. 18)

def.name: GoodCause
def.leadIn: Good cause (好的因由) in paragraph 1 means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: conviction of any crime which shall be judged by the Council to be of an immoral, scandalous or disgraceful nature;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: actual physical or mental in capacity which shall be judged by the Council to prevent the proper execution of the duties of the officer or membership; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any conduct which shall be judged by the Council to be of an immoral, scandalous or disgraceful nature.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Council may for good cause as defined in paragraph 5 remove from their appointments the Vice-Chancellor, the Pro-Vice-Chancellors, the Heads of the original Colleges and of Shaw College, the Masters of the additional Colleges, any of the Professors, the Secretary, the Registrar, the Librarian, the Bursar and any other person holding an academic or administrative appointment made by the Council. (Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5; L.N. 174 of 2010; 28 of 2023 s. 18)

section.name: s4
section.content: The Council may and shall if requested by the person concerned or by any 3 members of the Council before such removal appoint a committee consisting of the Chairman of the Council, 2 other members of the Council and 3 members of the Senate to examine the complaint and to report to the Council thereof.

def.name: GoodCause
def.leadIn: Good cause (好的因由) in paragraph 3 means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: conviction of any crime which the Council after consideration if necessary of a report of the committee referred to in paragraph 4 shall consider to be of an immoral, scandalous or disgraceful nature;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: actual physical or mental in capacity which the Council after consideration if necessary of a report of the committee referred to in paragraph 4 shall consider to be such as to render the person concerned unfit for the execution of the duties of his office or appointment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: conduct of an immoral, scandalous or disgraceful nature which the Council after consideration if necessary of a report of the committee referred to in paragraph 4 shall consider to be such as to render the person concerned unfit to continue to hold his office or appointment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: conduct which the Council after consideration if necessary of a report of the committee referred to in paragraph 4 shall consider to be such as to constitute failure or inability to perform the duties of his office or appointment or to comply with the conditions of the tenure of his office or appointment.

section.name: s6
section.content: Subject to the terms of his appointment no person referred to in paragraph 3 shall be removed from his appointment save for good cause as defined in paragraph 5 and in pursuance of the procedure specified in paragraph 4.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: No student shall be permitted to pursue an approved course of study for a Bachelor’s degree of the University unless he shall have—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: been admitted by and to the University;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: been registered as a matriculated student of the University; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: satisfied such other requirements for admission to the course as shall have been prescribed by regulation.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: No student shall be permitted to pursue an approved course of advanced study or research leading to a certificate, diploma or higher degree of the University unless he shall have—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: been admitted by and to the University;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: been registered as an advanced student of the University; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: satisfied such other requirements for admission to the course as shall have been prescribed by regulation.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: No student shall be permitted to pursue an approved course of study or research not leading to a degree or diploma of the University unless he shall have—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: been registered as an associate student of the University; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: satisfied such other requirements for admission to the course as shall have been prescribed by regulation.

section.name: s4
section.content: Each student shall be subject to the disciplinary control of the University.

section.name: s5
section.content: The University may demand and receive from any student such fees as the Council may from time to time determine.

section.name: s6
section.content: The Senate shall from time to time determine the requirements which an applicant must fulfil for matriculation as a student of the University.

section.name: s7
section.content: There may be a University Students Union. The constitution shall be subject to the approval of the Council.

section.name: s8
section.content: There may be a Students Union for each College. The constitution shall be subject to the approval of the Council, on the recommendation of the Assembly of Fellows of the College concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The University may confer any of the degrees with the designations prescribed in paragraph 2(1) to students who— (Amended L.N. 31 of 1981; L.N. 121 of 1989; L.N. 6 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have attended an approved course of study;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have passed the appropriate examination or examinations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: have complied in all other respects with the requirements prescribed therefor.

subsection.content: The University may confer any of the degrees with the designations prescribed in paragraph 2(2) on any person who has rendered distinguished service in the advancement of any branch of learning or who has otherwise rendered himself worthy of such a degree. (Added L.N. 31 of 1981. Amended L.N. 121 of 1989)

section.name: s3
section.content: The degree of Bachelor shall not be conferred upon a student unless he shall have attended approved courses of study as a matriculated student of the University. (Amended L.N. 114 of 1991)

content.leadIn: The Senate may accept as part of the attendance of a student qualifying him for the conferment of the degree of Bachelor periods of attendance as a registered student at another university or institution of higher learning recognized by the Senate for this purpose: (Amended L.N. 114 of 1991; L.N. 453 of 1994)

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that the degree of Bachelor shall not be conferred upon such student unless—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: he shall have attended an approved course of study as a matriculated student of the University for at least 2 academic years; and (Amended L.N. 114 of 1991; L.N. 453 of 1994; L.N. 233 of 2007)

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: his total period of attendance as a matriculated student of the University and as a registered student of another university or institution of higher learning shall not be less than 3 academic years. (Replaced L.N. 453 of 1994. Amended L.N. 233 of 2007)

section.name: s5
section.content: The Senate may accept a certificate of proficiency in any subject issued by another university or institution of higher learning recognized for this purpose by the Senate as exempting from any examination of the University in such subject for the degree of Bachelor. (Amended L.N. 453 of 1994)

section.name: s6
section.content: Save as provided in paragraphs 10 and 11, the degree of Master shall not be conferred upon any person in any Faculty unless he has pursued an approved course of study or research for a period of at least 12 months after satisfying the requirements for the conferment of the degree of Bachelor in the Faculty concerned or after admission as a postgraduate student in terms of paragraph 9.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: Save as provided in paragraphs 10 and 11, the degree of Doctor of Philosophy in any Faculty shall not be conferred upon any person unless he has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: followed an approved course of research as a student of the University for a period of at least 24 months after satisfying the requirements for the conferment of the degree of Bachelor in the Faculty concerned or after admission as a postgraduate student in terms of paragraph 9; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submitted a thesis which is certified by examiners to make a distinct contribution to the knowledge or understanding of the subject and to afford evidence of originality shown either by the discovery of new facts or by the exercise of independent critical power.

subsection.content: A person who has graduated in another university or who as a registered student of Chung Chi College, The United College of Hong Kong or New Asia College has obtained before the date of establishment of the University a diploma or certificate issued by or on behalf of such Colleges may be exempted from the matriculation requirement of the University and may be admitted as a postgraduate student and may proceed to the degree of Master or Doctor under such conditions as may be prescribed by the Statutes and by decrees and regulations made thereunder.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: has satisfied such other requirements as may be prescribed by the Statutes and by decrees and regulations made thereunder,

subsection.continued: may be exempted from the matriculation requirements of the University and may be admitted to be a postgraduate student with the approval of the Senate.

section.name: s10
section.content: The Senate may recommend the award of the degree of Master or Doctor in any Faculty to any member of the academic staff of the University and for this purpose may exempt any such person from any of the requirements prescribed for the conferment of the degree other than the examination therefor.

content.leadIn: The Council may recommend the award without requiring attendance or examination of a degree of Master or Doctor honoris causa: (Amended L.N. 31 of 1981)
content.proviso: Provided that the holder of a degree which has been conferred honoris causa shall not, by the fact that he has been admitted thereto, be entitled to practise any profession.

section.name: s12
section.leadIn: The Council shall not recommend the award of any degree of Master or Doctor honoris causa except after consideration of recommendations submitted by an Honorary Degrees Committee consisting of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chancellor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Heads of the original Colleges and of Shaw College; (Amended 18 of 2007 s. 5)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Council;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: 2 members of the Council nominated by the Council; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: 4 members elected by the Senate from among its own members. (Replaced 18 of 2007 s. 5)

section.name: s13
section.leadIn: The University may award diplomas and certificates—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: have attended an approved course of study;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: have passed the appropriate examination or examinations; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: have complied in all other respects with the requirements prescribed therefor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to persons other than those provided for in subparagraph (a) above who are deemed by the Senate to possess the qualification appropriate for the award of such diplomas and certificates provided that such persons—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: have passed the appropriate examination or examinations of the University.

section.name: s14
section.content: Subject to the right of appeal from the decision of the Senate to the Council and from the decision of the Council to the Chancellor, the Senate may deprive any person who has been convicted of an arrestable offence or who in their opinion has been guilty of dishonourable or scandalous conduct of any degree, diploma, certificate or other award of the University.

schedule.text: Examinations of the University shall be conducted in accordance with regulations made by the Senate from time to time.
The Statutes may be cited as the Statutes of The Chinese University of Hong Kong.

editorialNote.content: For the transitional and saving provisions relating to the amendments made by The Chinese University of Hong Kong (Amendment) Ordinance 2023 (28 of 2023), see sections 19 and 20 of that Ordinance.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Constitution and Powers of the Boards of Trustees of the Original Colleges

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—Boards of Trustees (書院校董會) means the Boards of Trustees of the Colleges incorporated under paragraph 2;Chairman (主席) means the Chairman of each Board of Trustees;College (書院) means an original College and Colleges (各書院) shall be construed accordingly; (59 of 1986 s. 4)Council (大學校董會) means the Council of The Chinese University of Hong Kong.

subsection.content: There shall be a Board of Trustees of Chung Chi College which shall be a body corporate and shall have the name of “The Trustees of Chung Chi College” and in that name shall have perpetual succession, and may sue and be sued, and shall have and use a common seal.

There shall be a Board of Trustees of The United College of Hong Kong which shall be a body corporate and shall have the name of “The Trustees of The United College of Hong Kong” and in that name shall have perpetual succession, and may sue and be sued, and shall have and use a common seal.

There shall be a Board or Trustees of New Asia College which shall be a body corporate and shall have the name of “The Trustees of New Asia College” and in that name shall have perpetual succession, and may sue and be sued, and shall have and use a common seal.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Powers and duties of Boards of Trustees

subsection.content: Each Board of Trustees shall hold in trust, and administer for the benefit of its College the movable property which is vested in the Board under paragraph 7; and shall hold in trust for the benefit of the University the buildings the subject of the agreements to be made under paragraph 2 of Schedule 2*.
Subject to subparagraph (3), each Board of Trustees may, for the purpose of the trusts under subparagraph (1), exercise the powers conferred on trustees by the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29).
A Board of Trustees shall not, without the prior approval of the Council, which may be subject to such conditions as the Council thinks fit, accept any gift for the benefit of the College.
Each Board shall make written provision for its procedure in the transaction of business, the discharge of its aims and duties and the maintenance of good order at its meetings.

subsection.leadIn: The Board of Trustees of Chung Chi College shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: recommend to the Council, through the Administrative and Planning Committee, all appointments to the Theology Division, or whatever part of the University shall succeed the Division as being responsible for theological education, including the appointment of the Head of the Theology Division (or equivalent post) and of the warden of the Theology Hostel;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: provide for and appoint the Chaplain of the Chapel; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: advise the Senate on all major policy matters relating to theological education,

subsection.continued: and the Board of Trustees may delegate to a Theological Council appointed by it the power to discharge the functions and duties imposed on the Board by this subparagraph.

editorialNote.content: * For text of Schedule 2, see the Revised Edition of the Laws.

subsection.content: The persons who, immediately before the commencement* of this Ordinance, were members of the Board of Governors of Chung Chi College shall, on the commencement of this Ordinance, become the members of the Board of Trustees of that College incorporated under paragraph 2(1).

The persons who, immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance, were members of the Board of Trustees of The United College of Hong Kong shall, on the commencement of this Ordinance, become members of the Board of Trustees of that College incorporated under paragraph 2(2).

The persons who, immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance, were members of the Board of Governors of New Asia College shall, on the commencement of this Ordinance, become members of the Board of Trustees of that College incorporated under paragraph 2(3).

Any person who is at the commencement of this Ordinance, or who becomes, a member of a Board of Trustees may retire as a member of that Board of Trustees, but no person shall retire so as to reduce the number of members of the Board of Trustees below 4.

Vacancies in the number of members of a Board of Trustees shall from time to time be filled by such legal means as would have been available for the appointment of new trustees if the Board of Trustees had not been incorporated, and, without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, section 42 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) shall apply in relation to the appointment of new Trustees. (Amended 59 of 1986 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: Each Board of Trustees shall forward to the Registrar of Companies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notice of the address of the principal office of the Board of Trustees and any change thereof;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a copy of the written provision made under paragraph 3(4), and any change therein, certified as correct by the Chairman.

subsection.leadIn: Notification in accordance with subparagraph (1)(a) and (b) shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 3 months of the commencement* of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: thereafter within 28 days of any change.

subsection.content: Notification under subparagraph (1)(c) shall be made within 28 days after the making of any written provision under paragraph 3(4) or the making of any change therein.
Any person may inspect at the office of the Registrar of Companies any of the documents registered under this paragraph.
A fee of $5 shall be payable for registering or inspecting any document referred to in this paragraph.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Accounts
section.content: Each Board of Trustees shall in each year, prepare and produce to the Council its audited accounts in such form and at such times as the Council may determine.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Transitional provisions
section.leadIn: On the commencement* of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all movable property held on trust by or for each College and all immovable property held by or on behalf of the Colleges outside the precincts of the University shall vest in the Board of Trustees of the College concerned without further assurance and on the same trusts and subject to the same terms and conditions, if any, on which the same was then held;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Board of Trustees of each College shall succeed to all rights, privileges, obligations and liabilities of the Colleges relating to the property vested in the Boards of Trustees under subparagraph (a).

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Constitution and Powers of the Board of Trustees of Shaw College

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—Board of Trustees (書院校董會) means the Board of Trustees of Shaw College incorporated under paragraph 2;Chairman (主席) means the Chairman of the Board of Trustees;Council (大學校董會) means the Council of The Chinese University of Hong Kong;Planning Committee (籌劃委員會) means the Planning Committee for Shaw College established by the Council under section 10(1).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Incorporation of Board of Trustees
section.content: There shall be a Board of Trustees of Shaw College which shall be a body corporate and shall have the name of “The Trustees of Shaw College” and in that name shall have perpetual succession, and may sue and be sued, and shall have and use a common seal.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Powers and duties of Board of Trustees

subsection.content: The Board of Trustees shall hold in trust and administer for the benefit of Shaw College the movable property which is vested in the Board of Trustees by the University.
Subject to subparagraph (3), the Board of Trustees may, for the purpose of the trust under subparagraph (1), exercise the powers conferred on trustees by the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29).
The Board of Trustees shall not, without the prior approval of the Council, which may be subject to such conditions as the Council thinks fit, accept any gift for the benefit of Shaw College.

The Board of Trustees shall make written provision for its procedure in the transaction of business, the discharge of its aims and duties, the appointment and retirement of its members and the maintenance of good order at its meetings.

subsection.leadIn: The persons who, immediately before the commencement* of The Chinese University of Hong Kong (Declaration of Shaw College) Ordinance (Cap. 1139) were members of the Planning Committee shall, on the commencement of that Ordinance, become members of the Board of Trustees.

subsection.content: Members of the Board of Trustees who become such members under subparagraph (1) shall hold office for a period of 1 year from the commencement of The Chinese University of Hong Kong (Declaration of Shaw College) Ordinance (Cap. 1139) and shall, subject to the written provision made under paragraph 3(4), be eligible for re-appointment.

Any person who on the commencement of The Chinese University of Hong Kong (Declaration of Shaw College) Ordinance (Cap. 1139) is, or who becomes, a member of the Board of Trustees may retire as a member of the Board, but no person shall retire so as to reduce the number of members of the Board of Trustees below 4.

Vacancies in the number of members of the Board of Trustees shall from time to time be filled in accordance with the written provision made under paragraph 3(4) or by such legal means as would have been available for the appointment of new trustees if the Board of Trustees had not been incorporated, and, without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, section 42 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) shall apply in relation to the appointment of new Trustees.

subsection.leadIn: The Board of Trustees shall forward to the Registrar of Companies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notice of the address of the principal office of the Board of Trustees and any change thereof;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a copy of the written provision made under paragraph 3(4), and any change therein, certified as correct by the Chairman.

subsection.leadIn: Notification in accordance with subparagraph (1)(a) and (b) shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 3 months of the commencement* of The Chinese University of Hong Kong (Declaration of Shaw College) Ordinance (Cap. 1139); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: thereafter within 28 days of any change.

subsection.content: Notification under subparagraph (1)(c) shall be made within 28 days after the making of any written provision under paragraph 3(4) or the making of any change therein.
Any person may inspect at the office of the Registrar of Companies any of the documents registered under this paragraph.
A fee of $5 shall be payable for registering or inspecting any document referred to in this paragraph. (Amended E.R. 3 of 2021)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Accounts
section.content: The Board of Trustees shall in each year, prepare and produce to the Council its audited accounts in such form and at such times as the Council may determine.
